variants.Description in input context: D149A mutation in PARK7 (DJ-1) gene, which impairs caspase-6-mediated proteolysis and leads to increased cell death.
L166P mutation in PARK7 (DJ-1) gene, which also impairs caspase-6-mediated proteolysis but does not affect cell death.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Biochemical proteolysis assay and cell death analysis

Material used.Description: Experiments were conducted using neuroblastoma cells overexpressing PARK7 variants (D149A and L166P) to assess proteolysis and cell death.

Readout description.Result Description: D149A mutation significantly reduced caspase-6-mediated proteolysis of DJ-1 and increased apoptosis in neuroblastoma cells.
L166P mutation impaired proteolysis of DJ-1 but did not alter cell death compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in three independent biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was performed in triplicate to ensure reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK7-expressing cells were used as a positive control for proteolysis and cell death.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used to compare proteolysis and cell death rates between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Proteolysis rate ≥ 70% and apoptosis rate ≤ 10% compared to wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Proteolysis rate < 50% or apoptosis rate > 20% compared to wild-type.
